instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-000165 Not video
threads.message:
this macbook does not give video, it does not have usb data, it turns on and turns the fan, it does not give a green light.

some story: entry with humidity computer turned on with video but backlight worked sometimes. It had some resistors R5177, R5178, R5179 corroded, I changed them and it did not give video again, check resistors and they are well placed, I do not know when placing resistors affect the smc that are nearby. Any suggestions


PP3V42_G3H_REG= 3.41                                         
PPBUS_G3H=8.58
PP5V_S4RS3=5.1V
PP3V3_S5_REG=3.3V
PP1V05_S0=1.05
PP1V2_S3=1.2
PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH1=1.81
PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH2=1.81
SMC_RESET_L=3.3V
PLT_RESET_L=3.3V

threads.title: 820-000165 Not video
threads.message:
You should reball SMC anyway.
Check for more corroded components also.

For the Magsafe light issue, inspect J9500 pins and solders.
Try known good LIO board/flex.
